action.action-desc: Ms. Bass (for herself, Mr. Danny K. Davis of Illinois, Mr. Scott of Virginia, and Mr. Young of Alaska) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to repeal the suspension of eligibility for grants, loans, and work assistance for drug-related offenses.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stopping Unfair Collateral Consequences from Ending Student Success Act or SUCCESS Act.

section.header: Repeal of suspension of eligibility under the Higher Education Act of 1965 for grants, loans, and work assistance for drug-related offenses

subsection.text: Subsection (r) of section 484 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1091(r)) is repealed.
The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (C), by striking 485(l) and inserting 485(k); and
in subparagraph (D), by striking 485(l) and inserting 485(k);
in subparagraph (E), by striking 485(l) and inserting 485(k); and
in subparagraph (F), by striking 485(l) and inserting 485(k);

paragraph.text: in section 484 (20 U.S.C. 1091), by redesignating subsections (s) and (t) as subsections (r) and (s), respectively; and

subparagraph.text: by redesignating subsections (l) and (m) as subsections (k) and (l), respectively.
